messageBody:
Hi, the unit test suite on a particular project of mine has grown to the
point where I need to organize it some. I'd like to do something like
Rainsberger's JUnit recipe 4.6 "Separate the different kinds of test
suites"***. But for some reason I can't verbalize I don't like the
approach of classifying tests using a tag interface.

Instead, since I'm using Java 5, I'd prefer to use annotations. Does
anyone have an example TestFilter implementation that uses annotations
instead of tag interfaces? Or is there some other tool I should be
looking into?


Todd.

*** In other words, I want an easy way of tagging my tests in one (or
more) classifications, like "Short Test" or "Acceptance Test". And then
I want a TestSuite that I can tell to include only tests that fit
certain classifications.
----
Todd Bradley - Polycom - QA Lead, Super Secret Project
